name: Tropical Grilled Chicken Breast
description: Living in South Florida, I get to enjoy a diverse culture, from all the Latin and Caribbean influence down here. Friends and family all enjoy this simple recipe, hope you do to . . .
recipeIngredient: 4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together the orange juice, lime juice, honey, and red pepper flakes in a bowl, and pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.

Remove the chicken from the marinade, and shake off excess. Discard the remaining marinade. Place the chicken on the grill and cook the chicken breasts until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Top with cilantro and serve.

review.reviewBody: This was pretty good, soft and juicy, although i made a few adjustments to the marinade. I added 1 tsp of cumin and about 3 tbsp of olive oil. I find that by adding a it of oil the marinade and flavors stick to the chicken better. I would make this recipe again it was quite easy.

Tasty however it really didn't have the wonderful citrus flavor I was expecting - even with 24 hours of marinating. I loved the idea of this using orange juice paired with lime. I even added a bit of orange and lime zest to heighten the citrus flavor. It's mildly sweet and does have some citrus flavor but in the end the heat from the red pepper flakes prevailed....

Tasty and moist grilled chicken but would have liked more of the citrus flavor. Marinated for about three hours but next time I'll try putting the chicken in the marinade in the morning for an evening meal.

This recipe deserves five stars if you add minor adjustments to the dish ?? 
Marinating the skinless, boneless chicken breasts in 1 cup of Tropicana orange juice, 1 fresh squeezed lime, 1 Tablespoon of all natural honey, and Ciltranro, Adobe, Salt, and Peeper to taste in the fridge for 1 hour gives it a delious fragrant flavor. 

While the chicken marinated I put canned corn (drained) and drizzled in all natural honey, pepper, salt, and basil and cut up slices of yellow squash that was seasoned to taste by adding orangic extra virgin olive oil, honey, salt, pepper, Adobe, and garlic powder. 

Once an hour is up don't dicard the marinade, instead I chose to add it to a pan and cook it on the stove. Putting a lid over the marinaded chicken kept the flavors in and I added additional salt and pepper for extra flavor. I decided to add mini red and orange peppers into the mix to create another level of delicious flavors. You know it's done once the chicken has a nice carmalized finish to it and the juices are all absorbed into the chicken and mini bell peppers. 

Trust me your taste buds won't be disappointed!!!!

I used fresh squeezed orange juice and the juice of one lime as my lime wasn't very juicy. Like other reviewers I added the zest of half the orange and lime. Unlike other reviewers we did not find this sweet and in fact talked about adding a bit more honey the next time. We found the citrus flavor really was highlighted but I attribute that to the 10 hr marinate time and the fact that I did used freshly juiced fruit. I think the juice combination would make a great sauce if thickened with a bit of corn starch and boiled for several minutes (or make a fresh juice combination and cook less). We will try that next time.
I thought this recipe sounded fresh and tasty but the ingredients added little if any taste. Perhaps if marinated overnight? I may try that as I was a fan of the ingredient list.

I made this tonight for the first time and my boyfriend and I LOVED it. Out of all the chicken recipes I've taken off this site this one had the best flavor. I used more honey marinaded for about 4 hours and I didn't use cilantro because... well I had none. But it still tasted great!

Just made this tonight and it turned out great! My family loved it. I used a juice blend I had in the fridge an orange/mango/peach juice and the half of squeezed lime. The only other thing I changed was the amount of pepper flakes; I used only a dash since my family doesn't like that much heat. Overall the chicken turned out very moist and it was flavorful. I only marinated it about 1 hour in the fridge.
I think this marinade is excellent! I did use a full lime though to bring out some full more flavor. excellent!
